intro: Pteracanthus lachenensis, commonly known as the Lachen's pteracanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in dense forest understories. Its botanical features include a woody stem and palmate leaflets that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
